Package actor

Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
actor.GameObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Beacon, Bot, Paper, Rock, Scissors, Trail, Wall
public class GameObject extends Object
A GameObject is an entity with a color and direction that can act.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameObject()
    Constructs a blue actor that is facing north.
    GameObject​(GameObject in)
    Constructs a RatBotActor that copies the properties of another RatBotActor.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameObject

      public GameObject()
      Constructs a blue actor that is facing north.

    • GameObject

      public GameObject​(GameObject in)
      Constructs a RatBotActor that copies the properties of another RatBotActor.
      Parameters:
      in - the RatBotActor to be copied to construct this RatBotActor.

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Gets the color of this GameObject.
      Returns:
      the color of this GameObject

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(Color newColor)
      Sets the color of this GameObject.
      Parameters:
      newColor - the new color

    • getDirection

      public int getDirection()
      Gets the current direction of this GameObject.
      Returns:
      the direction of this GameObject as an angle. (0,90,180 or 270)

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(int newDirection)
      Sets the current direction of this GameObject.
      Parameters:
      newDirection - the new direction. The direction of this GameObject is set to the nearest lower multiple of 90 degrees of newDirection. (0,90,180 or 270)

    • getGrid

      public RatBotsGrid<GameObject> getGrid()
      Gets the grid in which this GameObject is located.
      Returns:
      the grid of this GameObject, or null if this GameObject is not contained in a grid

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation()
      Gets the location of this GameObject.
      Returns:
      the location of this GameObject, or null if this GameObject is not contained in a grid

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation​(Location loc)

    • getRow

      public int getRow()

    • getCol

      public int getCol()

    • putSelfInGrid

      public void putSelfInGrid​(Grid<GameObject> gr, Location loc)
      Puts this actor into a grid. If there is another actor at the given location, it is removed.
      Precondition: (1) This actor is not contained in a grid (2) loc is valid in gr
      Parameters:
      gr - the grid into which this actor should be placed
      loc - the location into which the actor should be placed

    • putSelfInGridNoLocation

      public void putSelfInGridNoLocation​(Grid<GameObject> gr)
      Puts this actor into a grid, but not into a specific Location. This is used for 'OffGrid' Actors such as PaintBalls and Explosions.
      Parameters:
      gr - the grid into which this actor should be placed

    • removeSelfFromGrid

      public void removeSelfFromGrid()
      Removes this actor from its grid.
      Precondition: This actor is contained in a grid

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(Location newLocation)
      Moves this actor to a new location. If there is another actor at the given location, it is removed.
      Precondition: (1) This actor is contained in a grid (2) newLocation is valid in the grid of this actor
      Parameters:
      newLocation - the new location

    • act

      public void act()
      Reverses the direction of this actor. Override this method in subclasses of Actor to define types of actors with different behavior

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Creates a string that describes this actor.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string with the location, direction, and color of this actor

    • getClone

      public GameObject getClone()
      Gets a clone of this GameObject
      Returns:
      a new GameObject which copies the properties of this GameObject
